metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0098 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Screen Capture in Google Chrome on Chrome OS prior to97.0.4692.71 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to perform specificuser gestures to potentially exploit heap corruption via specific usergestures.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
